intro: Pellegrinia paramensis, commonly known as the Paramense Paddleplant, is a succulent species native to South America, specifically found in the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features rosettes of thick, paddle-shaped leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in dry conditions. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the warmer months. Pellegrinia paramensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
